Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times compared to 2021

(Compiled on 11th) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore in 2023 is expected to reach 1.2 to 1.4 million, which will bring in approximately SGD18 billion to SGD21 billion in tourism revenue; the number of tourists and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2
Singapore's tourism market gradually restarted and recovered in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists in 2022 was 6.3 million, an increase of 19 times from 330,600 in 2021, exceeding the earlier estimate of 400,000 to 600,000, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue was 8.96 billion Singapore dollars, and it was expected that the tourism revenue for the whole year of 2022 would reach 13.8 to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which was 6 to 7 times that of 18.9 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and had already recovered to about 50% to 5
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to speed up the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly 500 million yuan to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The tourism bureau announced recently that it would allocate 110 million yuan from this budget in the next two years to promote more business and leisure activities to attract tourists back.

To make healthy living a tourist highlight in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board has launched a consultation event on November 23, 2022, to develop a healthy living site on the southern coast of Singapore.

Ms Wang Liling, the director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that more and more tourists have put their physical health at the top of their considerations in recent years.

Developing a healthy living site in Pasir Panjang, which has a coastline, a promenade and a bay garden, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism industry and economy, and make tourists stay longer in Singapore.
Chen Jianlong, the director of Singapore Tourism Board, said that health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products in the next few years.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Bureau has been promoting healthy living programs to the local community and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, providing more than 130 types of health activities and experiences for the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences for tourists.

Besides the newly opened Children's Museum and the Avatar World in Gardens by the Bay, the Central Market at Orchard Road, the ArtScience Museum's new "Explore New Frontiers" gallery, and the open-air theatre at the Night Safari, the tourism board will support the development and updating of projects such as the Wildlife World of 10,000 Animals' Bird Park to make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate industry standards for the sustainable development of the meeting, exhibition and incentive travel industry by 2023, and focus on improving the two major issues of waste disposal and carbon emissions to further optimize the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

According to the data, as of December 18, 2022, the passenger throughput of Tianjin Binhai International Airport has been recovering strongly, with daily passenger throughput reaching 150,000 and weekly passenger throughput reaching 100,000, which is equivalent to about 75% of the pre-pandemic level, and the number of aviation personnel has also recovered to about 90

Data shows that from January to October 2022, Singapore received 23.6 million passenger trips, accounting for 42% of the pre-pandemic level, and 1.7 million take-off and landing flights, accounting for 53% of the pre-pandemic level.
The tourism industry has quickly recovered, and has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

Cheng Shu Dan, the assistant director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that according to a survey by a Chinese travel platform, Singapore has a high safety index, which is one of the reasons why it is popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese tourists visited Singapore for vacation every year.
With China relaxing its border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30% to 60% of the 2019 level this year.
Chen Shu Dan pointed out that the next step, the tourism bureau will closely monitor the signals of further loosening of China's outbound travel policies to meet the changing needs of tourists.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, the Singapore Tourism Board will also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in response to new trends in outbound tourism in China.

Looking forward to 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is optimistic that the global economy will not experience a significant downturn that affects public income, and there will be no new large-scale deadly epidemic outbreaks, and the recovery of the tourism industry will be faster than expected.

In addition, the strong demand for excess savings and consumer credit in the United States will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market.

"Fund E-account" has arrived: Securities Regulatory Commission authorizes the development of the consolidation and inquiry of all funds under the name of investors - Economic Observer - Professional financial news website
Economic Observer reporter Chen Zhen: The complexity of the channels for purchasing funds makes it difficult to collect account information?
Have you ever forgotten the "small treasure chest"?
These problems of the BJP will soon be solved.
On February 10, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced that the "Fund E-account" APP has been listed and publicly tested in various mobile application stores.

According to the introduction, "Fund E-account" is a "one-stop" inquiry service for personal investors to provide information on public fund accounts and shareholdings, which aims to solve the pain points of the industry service that many small and medium investors forget their accounts and the inquiry is complicated.

According to Wind data, by the end of 2022, there were 156 domestic fund management companies, managing a total of 2.6 trillion yuan in funds; 167 fund registration institutions, and 411 fund sales institutions.
Each registration agency account system is independent of each other, and there is no unified query channel for the industry.

According to some industry insiders, by the end of 2021, there were more than 720 million investors in China's mutual funds, meaning that half of the population of the country had invested in mutual funds.

Before, investors had to inquire about the purchase situation through different sales channels, but through the "Fund E-account", they can inquire about the purchase situation of all sales channels, and the situation of holding the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E-account" APP?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E-account" APP is a mobile application developed and constructed by the China Securities Regulatory Commission for the public fund industry, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the holding situation of the fund product outside the market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp their holdings of fund products managed by various fund managers through the "Fund E-Account" in all sales channels, and comprehensively improve the efficiency of inquiry.

Specifically, investors can obtain the following information through the “Fund E-account”: the account information of funds managed by fund management companies in the whole market, the account information of trading accounts opened by fund sales institutions, and the holding situation of the fund products that do not have a limit of 200 investors, including public offering securities investment funds and investment products established by securities companies to manage assets.

Liu Yiqian, the business manager of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told Economic Observer that investors can know all their outside-the-exchange fund holdings through the "Fund E-Account" App, which helps them recover "forgotten assets". More importantly, it collects all the information of the investor's fund investment situation, which helps the investor to understand their investment situation more timely, accurately and comprehensively, and optim
How do I register?

Reporters noticed that the "Fund E-account" APP has been listed on Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the APP is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, which can be obtained by contacting the fund manager of the fund held by the investor.

An employee of a large-scale public fund in Shanghai provided an Economic Observer reporter with a six-digit invitation code and said, "During the trial operation of the APP, China Settlement provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, and investors can get them by calling the phone number. We will provide them.
After the trial run is over, you don't need an invitation code to register.

The reporter downloaded and used the relevant files of the “Fund E-account” registration and inquiry instructions from the Securities Regulatory Commission website, and completed the registration and inquiry in a few minutes, mainly including user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund inquiry.

After completing the real name authentication step, click the “Asset” fund binding button. All fund products purchased by the reporter through the sales platform of each fund will be presented in the binding options list (account binding) after the binding is completed, and the total assets of the invested funds can be directly viewed, and the query function can be started.
It is worth noting that the "Fund E-account" only provides query services to investors, and cannot be used for redemption or purchase.
The data date displayed in the "Fund E Account" is generally three trading days before the date the user inquired (T day).

For example, when you open the "Fund E-account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value corresponding to the date on the asset page are three trading days before the date, i.e., February 7.

The Federation of Trade Unions Mobilizes a Large-scale Demonstration to Promote the Retirement Reform Again
On Saturday (February 11), French unions called for a national mobilization against the government's pension reform bill, urging people to take to the streets and express their opinions.
This is the fourth day of social movements opposing the government's pension reform bill.
The number of people who respond to the call to rally could influence the next step of the labor union.

This is the fourth time that the eight major French trade unions have jointly launched a national mobilization in the past month, and the first time that the protest has been scheduled for a Saturday.
Given that most French people have the weekend off, the unions hope that the rally will attract more people, as they don't have to choose between joining a protest or going on strike.

The unions of the metro and public railway companies did not call for a strike today, so the metro and public railway should be able to operate normally, and citizens can travel by car to the rally site, and people in areas where schools have started winter vacation can travel normally to start their vacation.
Union groups hope for more than a million people to attend the rally, while police expect the national total to be between 600,000 and 800,000, with 90,000 to 120,000 in Paris.

Since the pension reform protest movement began, although polls show that most French people do not support delaying the retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who actually take to the streets to participate in the parade has gradually decreased.
The first strike and demonstration on January 31st attracted 1.27 million to 2.5 million people across the country.
The number of protesters on Monday (February 7) was estimated to be between 757,000 and 2 million, down from the 1.5 million who took to the streets last week.
The pension reform is currently under discussion in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition, especially in the opposition party led by the radical left, numerous amendment proposals were submitted, which slowed down the legislative process.
And the debate between the government and the opposition has become increasingly sharp.

A French lawmaker from the far-left La France Insoumise party has sparked controversy by posting a picture of herself on social media with a balloon bearing the face of Labour Minister Muriel Penicaud, after stepping on it.

The Speaker of the National Assembly finally announced that the member of parliament would be banned from participating in the activities of the National Assembly for 15 days as a punishment for this behavior.
Despite the recent 20 years of the largest social trend in France, the government has only made slight adjustments to the bill, but has not made any major concessions.

The union has already prepared to launch a second round of protests on Thursday, March 16, and also planned to organize a demonstration when the reform bill was submitted to the National People's Congress for discussion on March 7.

Last communist leader of East Germany dies
The successor to the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "last night, Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95.
So we have lost a great leader.
On Nov. 13, 1989, just four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, dividing East and West Berlin for 28 years, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, the leaders of the communist party were forced to step down due to protests for democracy and freedom in various parts of East Germany.
Mikhail Gorbachev, who came to power in the Soviet Union, has called for reforms in Eastern Europe, which is under Soviet control.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic.
The election results forced him to resign as prime minister.
Despite his reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and unification that took place in October 1990.
He has also been criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, he was convicted of election fraud in the 1989 mayoral election but was not jailed.
Some have called the allegations politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament and was a member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modi sees himself as a reformer and wants to change the party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want the old East Germany to return, but that its achievements should be acknowledged.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the small German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica, Poland) and received an education as a mechanic.
During World War II, he was a leader of a youth fire brigade and became a member of the Nazi militia Volkssturm, which was formed to draft men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles.
At 17, Modro was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he underwent anti-fascist training and became a committed communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found a job as a mechanic, and continued to study social sciences and economics, and earned a doctorate.

Modrow was a functionary in the Free German Youth, a youth movement that almost all young East Germans joined, and rose to the chairmanship of the Socialist Unity Party (SED) in the Dresden region from 1973 to 1989.
He served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, taking on the highest state functions.

Earthquake rescue in Tangshan continues day and night

Rescue teams from more than 40 countries have been working around the clock to clear the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings in Syria, which borders Turkey, where a powerful earthquake struck, to free those buried under the rubble.
At the cold temperatures, they often call for quiet as they strain to hear any signs of life from the rubble.
Reuters reported that two women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after surviving for several days.
But the death toll has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has reported 20,665 deaths, and more than 3,500 in Syria.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria on Monday has been followed by several strong aftershocks, making it the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the death toll from Japan's 2011 earthquake and tsunami and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by Iran's 2003 earthquake.
A similar strong earthquake in northwest Turkey in 1999 caused more than 17,000 deaths.

Turkish officials said Saturday that two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake in the region in two decades, and rescue workers pulled them from the rubble of a collapsed building in Turkey.
Another man, 55, was confirmed dead, Masallah Cicek, who was pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, Turkey's southeastern largest city.
At freezing temperatures, rescuers often call for quiet as they strain to hear any sign of life from the rubble.
In the Samandag district of Turkey, rescue workers crouch under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" -- "God willing" -- as they carefully reach into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He blinked his eyes and carried his baby Yagiz Ulas wrapped in a blanket to the field hospital.
Video footage shows the man's mother being carried away, with her head hanging low and her face pale, but she appeared to be conscious.

Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters in the early hours of Monday that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and 31,000 rescue personnel were mobilized in the disaster area.
He said about 80,000 people were in hospitals and 1.05 million were homeless, crammed into temporary shelters.
The leaders of the two countries have been criticized for their response to the disaster, as many people are struggling to find food in the harsh winter conditions.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo on Saturday, the first time he has visited a disaster area since the earthquake, state media reported.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said its stocks in rebel-held northwest Syria were running low because of the complexity of aid work in the conflict zone.
Erdogan visited Adiyaman province on Friday and admitted the government's response had not been quick enough.
Opponents seized on the issue to attack Erdoğan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14, but who may have to postpone it because of the disaster.
The Associated Press said that the anger of delaying aid and starting rescue work may affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most severe challenge to Erdogan's 15-year rule.
Erolan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative movements" for political purposes.
Turkey's main opposition leader, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, criticized the government's response.
Critics say the earthquake was bad, but the lack of coordination, planning and ability was worse.

What was the 'object' that fell from the sky in Alaska?
The Bokor Mountains are shrouded in mist, and the guesses are endless.
The U.S. military again deployed its most advanced stealth fighter, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the skies over Alaska on Friday afternoon (February 10).
The debris was found about 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
It's the second time in less than a week that the U.S. military has shot down an object in the air.
A Chinese spy balloon that had been floating in U.S. airspace for several days was shot down off the coast of South Carolina last Saturday.

The second object was first detected in U.S. airspace on Thursday evening, moving over the skies of northeastern Alaska, and was tracked by the U.S. military at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon still does not have any evidence that this object is controllable.

White House national security adviser John Bolton said Friday that the specifics of the object that flew in the sky were not clear, but that it "constituted a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aviation."
Kobe said that this object is different from the spy balloon found in the United States, which does not have a "payload" hanging on it.
"We call it an 'object' because that's the best way we can describe it," Kobe said.
Biden consulted with the Pentagon before ordering the strike, Kobbi said, and he made the decision "very carefully."

The official description of the object in the US can be roughly summarized as: the size is similar to a small car, without control rod, without suspension, and the flying height is about 10,000 meters.
But the information doesn't answer basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what it is doing.
Many online analyses and speculations believe that this is another Chinese balloon.

It may be the same as the spy balloon that invaded the US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated in the sky in Latin America, which are both from China, and they are performing different tasks at different locations.
Some people have linked the "object" in Alaska with the "unidentified flying object" (UFO).
The news magazine quoted former U.S. Congressman Peter Meijer, who tweeted on Friday, "I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO."
"The joke of conflating alien spacecraft with weather balloons is a clever one, but it's not worth sparking an intergalactic conflict," Meyer said.
Melo tweeted this after Kobe's Alaskan object was knocked down.
Newsweek said that it was not just Mejia who doubted that the object was a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett criticized the government's handling of the withholding of information about the "unidentified aerial phenomena" and called for the Office of the Director of National Intelligence to release the report.

I wouldn't recommend reading it.
I read it a long time ago, and I just happened to see the memory notes after reading it.
This book is not a collection of short stories, but a collection of fragments of love in life.
The tone of the book is very calm, like the calmness of water, the words and sentences are simple and concise, and the plot is also calm and peaceful, like a quiet afternoon street in summer.
Each short is a clip of a mundane moment in life, without a beginning or an end.
Finally, all the pieces were put together and the book was named "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".

I think this collection of stories, and its title, is a kind of performance art, and the author wants to express that love is not just the tragic and joyful separation on the stage, the dried-up and withered life in urban legends, and not just the glue-like and paint-like you and me, but also the quiet and monotonous life, the dull and tasteless days, and also the helplessness, the escape from reality, and the uncertainty of
As you read this book , you may recall the quarrelsome couple next door , the friendless marriage of an acquaintance , and the disappointing love affair .

This is why I don’t recommend it: from a critical perspective, the writing and plot are both bland, and unless your life is as exciting as a roller coaster or as sweet as a candy castle, you’ll feel like you’re reading something that’s just weird and boring.

And from a depth of thought, the daily situations do not make people bright or expand their thinking and vision (this is different from Marx's "Love in the Time of Revolution"), and the brief fragments do not discuss any problems, such as what kind of mistake led to the failure of love?
what were the reasons for the protagonist's marital breakdown?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn't matter much.
The author's ideas are more expressed through technique and tone than through plot, which is why the reading experience is less satisfying.
It's suitable for coarse reading, not for fine reading.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not rich enough.
many sales theories have been explained, but few have provided practical guidance on how to do it.
Also, the book feels like it was cobbled together.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign ones, and some are well-known businessmen or salesmen, while others are not well-known but have a good reputation.
I don't know if the story was compiled for the sake of an example, but if some authors' own cases were cited, it would be more convincing.
The term for the customer has changed from customer to client.
The title is still customer, but the body is changed to customer.
There were also problems with misspelled words, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering in the e-book.
In short, this book is a good choice for a theoretical introduction, but it is not suitable for people who have already been engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales skills.

i'm watching you, and i want you to know!
The first factor in determining a person's satisfaction with their job is not the salary, but whether they feel valued and appreciated in their work.

According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, after the basic needs of human survival are met, the most urgent need is to meet the psychological needs - the need to be understood, affirmed, and recognized.
In fact, for Chinese people, it is "love you in the depths of my heart", even if they love, appreciate and praise, they will keep it in their heart and not say it out loud.

In this book, the author explains five languages of appreciation: the language of affirmation, the language of appreciation, the language of connection, the language of service, and the language of touch.

I don't think it's important that you know what the five languages are, but that you can use them spontaneously to praise, appreciate, and thank the people in your life - your family, your friends, your colleagues - for what they do for you.
The closer the people, the more praise and thanks they need, and our lives become more beautiful.
Learn to praise, and companies can retain talent to a certain extent and reduce turnover.
Thank you for bringing us the exciting ideas and the world from abroad.
Because of the differences in cultural backgrounds, there are differences in language, and if there is an opportunity to see the original version, it will be more beneficial.
Thanks to the authors, translators, and editors for their hard work!

The worst shopping experience I've ever had

On the evening of September 23, my wife's mobile phone was dropped, and I immediately ordered an 8P from Litecoin in Malaysia. It was delivered, but it was not self-operated and there was no price increase (I was secretly happy), but because it was not self-operated, the delivery was slower, and the system showed that the latest delivery time was September 27.

My wife didn't have a phone and died of it, she called me at 6:30 in the morning the next day and said she was thinking of a way to get a phone, and then she saw that there was a 256G phone that could be delivered the same day, so she had to order another one right away.
I just bought a new one, so I want to cancel my Amazon order.

Since the order was placed at midnight, it was impossible to receive the express delivery in the morning, so I called the customer service at 7:30 to cancel the order, and the customer service replied that the order had been cancelled and I should wait for the SMS notification.

OK, I will wait patiently. At noon, I checked my phone and found that the order was still in the status of not shipped. I immediately contacted the customer service to request that the order be cancelled as soon as possible. The customer service replied that the operation was successful.

At 3pm, I checked my phone and found that the order was still there. I couldn't do anything but call the customer service again to confirm that I had called for the third time, and asked them to cancel the order and tell the seller not to ship it!

The customer service representative contacted the seller at my request and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system and would need to familiarize himself with it before canceling the order.
But the seller has told me that they will not be shipping, so please don't worry.
I checked the orders on Monday and found that they had already been shipped. I was speechless.
Because I couldn't contact the seller directly, I had to call customer service again.
The handling behind was simple, I said one step, and the customer service just operated it.
The order is still in the status of delivery refused, and is preparing to be delivered again!
Amazon won't follow up on this, will it?
The seller company has already received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
In summary, I will never pay for a big thing in advance, this is too troublesome.
